text.name: Kaccāyanabyākaraṇaṃ
text.description:
The oldest text of Pāli grammar by Kaccāyana, substantially edited by J.R. Bhaddacak.
The running numbers have two systems, totally 675 (others) and 673 (Myammar), separated by a colon.
The numbers in brackets are of Padarūpasiddhi.
An 'x' marks an absence.

text.name: Padarūpasiddhi
text.description: The most well-known explanation on Kaccāyana by Buddhappiya.\nThe numbers in brackets are of Kaccāyana.

text.name: Mukhamattadīpanī (Nyāsa)
text.description: A substantial commentary on Kaccāyana by Vimalabuddhi.

text.name: Kaccāyanasuttaniddesa
text.description:
An explanation on Kaccāyana by Saddhammajotipāla (Chapata).
This text is based on the edtion by M. Medhankara: The Kachchayanasuttaniddesa, Colombo, 1915, digitized by Niedersächsische Staats - und Universitätsbibliothek Göttingen, transcribed by Aleix Ruiz Falqués, Cambridge (UK), May 2013.
The source is avialable at GRETIL, but this version is reformatted and slightly cleaned up by J.R. Bhaddacak.
*WARNING*: A serious reading of this should be carefully checked with the printed edition.

text.name: Bālāvatāra
